result.execSummary:
The defendant Karyn Jean Ward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:31 AM Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Karyn Jean Ward in court in custody from Dunn County jail.  Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin in court for Karyn Jean Ward. B. Bahr - Clerk 
20CF442, 22CF57

22CF57 - waiver of preliminary hearing
State - DE needs to waive prelim in this case.
DE - will waive prelim.
Court - provides waiver colloquy. Waiver of preliminary hearing voluntary - finds probable cause for bind over.

State - plea to 22CF57 - 4 years prison, bifurcated as 2 years IC, 2 yrs ES. No contact with CMW dob: 3/10/62 (victim in 20CF442). follow rec of agent. costs of $538 + $10 drug surchrge. concurrent to EC case or any other case. 139 days jail credit not including today. 20CF442 dismissed read in. No restitution requested.
Court - speaks of cash bond posted in 20CF442. 
DE - would like bond returned.
State - no issue with that.
Court - Orders bond to be returned in 20CF442. Provides plea colloquy.
DE - enters No Contest plea to 22CF57.
Parties stipulate to the facts.
Court - finds waiver of rights voluntary plea free & knowing & approves stips to facts.
State - asks court to accept joint agreement.
Atty Perrin - agrees court should accept joint agreement. Asks court to approve ERP.
DE - makes statement to the Court.

Court orders -
22CF57 -
4 years Wisconsin Prison System
2 years IC, 2 yrs ES 
Concurrent to Eau Claire Co case or any other case currently serving 
139 days jail credit
No contact with CMW dob: 3/10/62 
Follow recommendations of agent
Costs of $548.00
May not vote until rights are restored
May not possess a firearm
Eligible for ERP, CIP and SAP

20CF442 - DRI
Plea hearing on July 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:19 AM Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Karyn Jean Ward appeared by video in custody from DC Jail.  Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin appeared by video for Karyn Jean Ward. V. Girard - Clerk 
Atty Perrin - was waiting sent & revoc matter - set for trial on another case on 13/14th of July - asks for date after that
Court - bond cont
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

2:13 PM Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Karyn Jean Ward appeared by video in custody from Dunn County jail.  Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin appeared by video for Karyn Jean Ward. B. Bahr - Clerk 
20CF442, 22CF57
Court - notes Attorney Perrin was just appointed. 20CF442 is set for a Jury Trial. 22CF57 is a Branch 1 case. Defendant has requested a bond modification hearing in 20CF442.
Atty Perrin - DE is on a revocation hold. Hoping for an ATR. Can't pay $1,000 cash bond but could post $500 cash bond. Asks court to reduce bond to $500 cash.
State - court has heard a number of bond hearings for these matters. Objects to bond modification. Has pending felony cases in multiple counties.
Atty Perrin - if DE is granted the ATR there will be conditions to that. 
Court - modifies bond from $1,000 cash to $500 cash in 20CF442. Speaks of Jury Trial in 20CF442. FPT will be rescheduled to 3:15 pm on 6/23/22. 22CF57 is called for scheduling purposes - either a return date or preliminary hearing.
Atty Perrin - 22CF57 requesting a return date.
Court - schedules return date of 6/27/22 at 9:00 am in Branch 1 for 22CF57. Speaks to DE regarding the fact that she needs to sign the bond.  Notes DE has refused to sign bonds in the past.
Status hearing on April 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Court - tells deft to contact attorney Perrin, bond cont
to Reschedule
granting withdrawal of counsel

2:17 PM Prosecuting attorney Amber L Hahn in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Karyn Jean Ward appeared by video in custody from Dunn County jail.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman appeared by video for Karyn Jean Ward. B. Bahr - Clerk 
20CF442, 22CF57
Court - makes record of case. 22CF57 is a BR 1 case set in BR 3 when global resolution was offered. Speaks of Atty Chapman withdrawing.
Atty Chapman - will be withdrawing as counsel.
Court - explains that DE cannot choose her attorney from the Public Defender's office. 
DE - would like to go forward without counsel.
Court - approves Atty Chapman's motion to withdraw on both cases pending. Will schedule 20CF442 for trial. 22CF57 will be set for a status hearing in BR1 on 4/5/22 at 3:15 pm. 
State - will need 2 days for trial. 
Court - all filings due on or before 7/13/22. Sets 2 day Jury Trial. DE can still contact PD if she wants new counsel.
State - DE will need to call the Public Defenders office to request new counsel.
Final pre-trial scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Jury trial scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Granting Request to Appear Remotely
Counsel's Request to Appear Remotely

10:30 AM Prosecuting attorney Lucas D Arras appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Karyn Jean Ward appeared in court in custody from Dunn County jail, Attorney Daniel James Chapman for Karyn Jean Ward appeared by video. B. Bahr - Clerk 
20CF442, 22CF57
Court - makes record of case. Bond has not been signed in 20CF442.
Atty Chapman - notes this is defendant's request to address her bond.
Court - directs DE to send these requests through her attorney.
Atty Chapman - DE wants to fire him as counsel.
Court - speaks to DE.
DE - is able to post $200 cash bond. Does not like the plea agreement that was worked out. Will represent herself. Is fighting her revocation matter currently - set for April 18th. Asking for signature bond. Revocation is in Clark County.
Atty Chapman - revocation hearing is an administrative hearing.
State - objects to bond modification in both cases. DE is on a PO Hold and will not be released anyway. Both are victim cases. Speaks of several failures to appear in past. 20CF442 could be modified but cash in both is appropriate.
Court - denies bond modification in both matters. Speaks of plea hearing. Asks DE to sign bond in 20CF442. Will set matter for trial if DE will not plea on March 28th. Asks DE to communicate with Atty Chapman prior to March 28th. 
DE - understands 
Atty Chapman - does not want to take a position as counsel of record. Asking for Court to let him withdraw.  DE has requested this in writing.
Court - will address this request on March 28th. DE cannot select attorney when it is a Public Defender appointment.
Bail/bond hearing on March 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on March 11, 2022 at 09:15 am.
